agenda_items.title: Request to Address the Governing Board
agenda_items.subject: 6.1 Request to Address the Governing Board

narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Pursuant to Arizona Revised Statute 38-431.01(H), this agenda item provides an open Call to the Public allowing individuals an opportunity to address the Governing Board on any issue within the jurisdiction of the Governing Board. Members of the public wishing to address the Governing Board are required to complete a Public Participation Form and submit the completed form to the Superintendent prior to the meeting. Individuals recognized by the Board President must state his/her name. Speakers may comment on any item on the agenda or topics not listed on the agenda. No personal attacks on the Governing Board, staff or other community members will be allowed. Individual comment will be limited to no more than 3 minutes each, and no more than 30 minutes will be devoted to the Public Comment Portion of the Agenda. Governing Board members are not permitted to take action on any matter that is not on the agenda.

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval for Exemption Request to the School Facilities Division for Media Center Materials.
agenda_items.subject: 9.3 Consideration of Approval for Exemption Request to the School Facilities Division for Media Center Materials.
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the Exemption Request to the School Facilities Division for Media Center Materials as presented.

narratives.PURPOSE: Agua Fria High School District asked the Governing Board to approve the exemption request to the school facilities division for Media Center Materials for Goodyear High School per the public file attached.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: Administration recommends that the Governing Board approves the Exemption Request to the School Facilities Division for Media Center Materials as presented.
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: The District is requesting an exemption for R7-6-221(A) Ten Books per student Why is the District Seeking an Exception? Agua Fria High School District provides books in their libraries for student use on campus. These books are supplemented with digital media. The district does not plan to provide 10,000 physical books (1000 students x 10 books each) in the library at opening. The Alternative Solution the School Will Utilize: Agua Fria High School District plans to offer Britannica Escolar and Britannica Library as online resources for students. Also, in the Destiny Online Library students can access dictionaries, newspapers, encyclopedias, authors & books, research tools, etc. Pursuant to Arizona Administrative Code: R7-6-285. Guidelines Exception The School Facilities Board may grant an exception from any of the guidelines requirements, upon agreement between the Board and the school district. The Board shall grant an exception if it determines that the intent of the guideline is capable of being met by the school district in an alternate manner. If the Board grants the exception, the school district shall be deemed to meet the guideline and is not eligible for state funding to meet the guideline.

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval Intergovernmental Agreement (IGA) between the Agua Fria High School District (AFHSD)and the Maricopa County School Superintendent's Office
agenda_items.subject: 9.10 Consideration of Approval Intergovernmental Agreement (IGA) between the Agua Fria High School District (AFHSD)and the Maricopa County School Superintendent's Office
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves Intergovernmental Agreement (IGA) between the Agua Fria High School District (AFHSD) and the Maricopa County School Superintendent's Office

narratives.PURPOSE: The renewal of this Intergovernmental Governmental Agreement (IGA) would allow for Agua Fria High School District to remain part of the Maricopa County School Superintendent (MCSS) Financial System Support Consortium. The MCSS Financial System Consortium allows for Maricopa County School Superintendent's Office to host and support the district's Financial System.
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: The attached agreement outlines the responsibilities of each of the parties to manage the financial system as part of the MCSS Financial System Support Consortium. Cooperative agreements between and among public agencies in the state of Arizona have been shown to facilitate and improve competition, quality, and services, provide lower prices for materials and services, and avoid duplication efforts. AFHSD is requesting authorization to renew the IGA between the Agua Fria High School District and Maricopa County School Superintendent's Office to provide School ERP Pro, an integrated system that delivers the financial, human resources, payroll, and reporting functionality to meet the district's unique needs

narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Pursuant to Arizona Revised Statute 38-431.01(H), this agenda item provides an open Call to the Public allowing individuals an opportunity to address the Governing Board on any issue within the jurisdiction of the Governing Board. Members of the public wishing to address the Governing Board are required to complete a Public Participation Form and submit the completed form to the Superintendent prior to the meeting. Individuals recognized by the Board President must state his/her name. Speakers may comment on any item on the agenda or topics not listed on the agenda. No personal attacks on the Governing Board, staff or other community members will be allowed. Individual comment will be limited to no more than 3 minutes each, and no more than 30 minutes will be devoted to the Public Comment Portion of the Agenda. Governing Board members are not permitted to take action on any matter that is not on the agenda.

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval of Tri-Party Developer Contribution Agreement (Ascend I Development)
agenda_items.subject: 6.3 Consideration of Approval of Tri-Party Developer Contribution Agreement (Ascend I Development)
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the Tri-Party Developer Contribution Agreement (Ascend I Development) per the attached memorandum as presented.

narratives.PURPOSE: CRP/AR Prose Avondale Owner, LLC. is the owner of property known by the parties as Ascend l project, located South and East of the corner of Dysart Road and Indian School Road, as described in Exhibit A. Development of the property will increase the population of students attending public schools within the Agua Fria Union High School District and the Litchfield Elementary School District, which in turn will increase the need for public school facilities within the Districts. The owner is willing to make, and the Districts are willing to accept, cash contributions to defray the expense to the Districts associated with an increase in the population of students. These contribution agreements are often know as "rooftop fees".
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: The Administration recommends that the Governing Board approves the Tri-Party Developer Contribution Agreement (Ascend I Development) per the attached memorandum as presented.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: The total contribution will be contingent on the total number of multi-bedroom and non-age-restricted dwelling units contained on approved site plan. CRP/AR Prose Avondale Owner, LLC. will provide to AFUHSD the sum of $200 for each residential dwelling unit within the property, excluding any one (1) bedroom or studio apartment and age-restricted units to be constructed on the property.

attachments.label: CRPAR Prose (Ascend) Agreement LESD79 & Prose Signed Dec 2024.pdf (626 KB)

motion_and_voting.motion_text:
Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the Tri-Party Developer Contribution Agreement (Ascend I Development) per the attached memorandum as presented.Motion by Vickie Landis, second by Kristen Acton.
Final Resolution: Motion Carries
Yes: Kristen Acton, Eric Cultum, Vickie Landis, Corby Naylor, Sarah Silk

agenda_items.title: Instructional Time Model
agenda_items.subject: 4.2 Instructional Time Model

narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: STUDENT, EMPLOYEE, AND /OR COMMUNITY BENEFIT:
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: The Instructional Time Model under ARS 15-901.08 provides 100% of the base support level for full-time enrollment.
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Background: HB2862 requires two public hearings prior to the adoption of an Instructional Time Model. Administration will provide an overview of the proposed Agua Fria Union High School District Instructional Time Model for the spring 2025 semester. Students will learn independently and asynchronously. Learning will be supplemented by synchronous interaction with teachers. Teachers will maintain availability through email. Instructional activities will include videos, written material, practice work for recently learned material, project-based learning assignments, independent study, and mastery-based learning assignments in lieu of physical attendance in class.

agenda_items.title: Naming of Arts Academy
agenda_items.subject: 7.1 Naming of Arts Academy
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved the Governing Board approve option #1, #2, or #3 as the name for Arts Academy

narratives.RECOMMENDATION: Approval of option #1, #2, or #3 as the name for the Arts Academy
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: As part of the effort to establish a strong identity for our new Arts school, a comprehensive list of potential names was compiled through a process that invited suggestions/input from both staff and students. Once the list was compiled, the names were carefully reviewed and discussed, with particular attention given to their meaning, relevance, and potential impact. After thoughtful deliberation and analysis of the feedback received, three final name options were selected for Board consideration.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: By having the name of the school in place early, we are able to have maximum lead-time to minimize any construction related costs and eliminate the need for the reprinting of materials that have the Arts Academy label on them.
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: #1 - Hilltop School for the Arts #2- La Loma School for the Arts #3 - Litchfield Park School for the Arts Administration recommends that the Governing Board confirm the school name as a matter of procedure. STUDENT, EMPLOYEE AND/OR COMMUNITY BENEFIT: It is important to have the name of Arts Academy in place so that building signage and graphics, as well as school materials can be developed in a timely manner.

motion_and_voting.motion_text:
Be it resolved the Governing Board approve option #1 as the name for Arts AcademyMotion by Kristen Acton, second by Corby Naylor.
Final Resolution: Motion Carries
Yes: Kristen Acton, Vickie Landis, Corby Naylor, Sarah Silk
No: Eric Cultum

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval of Request for Qualifications #25-01-29 Millennium High School Campus Master Plan Phase 2 to Chasse Building Team
agenda_items.subject: 7.2 Consideration of Approval of Request for Qualifications #25-01-29 Millennium High School Campus Master Plan Phase 2 to Chasse Building Team
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board award a contract for RFQ #25-01-29 Millennium High School Campus Master Plan Phase 2 to Chasse Building Team.

narratives.PURPOSE: Administration seeks Governing Board approval to award a contract for Construction Manager at Risk Pre-Construction Services for Millennium High School Campus Master Plan Phase 2 to Chasse Building Team.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: It is recommended that the Governing Board award a contract for RFQ #25-01-29 Millennium High School Campus Master Plan Phase 2 to Chasse Building Team.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: On January 16, 2025, the District issued RFQ 25-01-29 Millennium High School Campus Master Plan Phase 2, to hire a general contractor to perform pre-construction and construction services. The solicitation was issued through OpenGov. Legal advertisement was published in the Arizona Business Gazette on January 16, 2025.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: The cost of pre-construction services will be $270,000 and will be funded through, 2024 Bond Funds (fund 630).
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: On February 6, 2025, Statements of Qualifications were received from five (5) vendors. Qualifications were read, scored and ranked based on the selection criteria listed in the RFQ. Through the rankings of the evaluation of Statements of Qualifications submitted, the evaluation committee determined each firm’s order of preference on the final list. Vendors who submitted proposals were notified of their status. Tom Huffman, Deputy Superintendent, entered negotiations with the highest ranked firm on the final list for pre-construction services. Administration seeks approval to award and enter into a contract with Chasse Building Team. Guaranteed Maximum Price (GMP) will be submitted for Board Approval once prepared. STUDENT, EMPLOYEE AND/OR COMMUNITY BENEFIT: A qualifications-based process ensures the District’s ability to contract with the General Contractor most qualified to execute the Millennium High School Campus Master Plan Phase 2.

motion_and_voting.motion_text:
Be it resolved that the Governing Board award a contract for RFQ #25-01-29 Millennium High School Campus Master Plan Phase 2 to Chasse Building Team.Motion by Kristen Acton, second by Eric Cultum.
Final Resolution: Motion Carries
Yes: Kristen Acton, Eric Cultum, Vickie Landis, Corby Naylor, Sarah Silk

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval of Compensation Increase and Benefits for eligible employees for 2025-2026
agenda_items.subject: 7.5 Consideration of Approval of Compensation Increase and Benefits for eligible employees for 2025-2026
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the compensation increase and benefits as presented for the 2025-2026 school year.

narratives.PURPOSE: To provide competitive salaries and compensation to retain the District's classified, certified, and administrative staff.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: Administration recommends the approval of the certified, classified, and administrative salary and compensation increase as well as the benefits for 2025-2026 as presented.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: The Governing Board has the legal responsibility for approving compensation amounts and benefits plans for the District in accordance with Governing Board Policy 4-101 Board Authority to Employ is the policy that pertains to setting and approving employee salaries, wages, and benefits. .
narratives.COMMUNITY_BENEFIT: Especially during an era of critical employee shortages in public education, competitive salaries help to recruit and retain qualified employees to provide a high quality education to our students and for our community.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: Costs are funded through M&O budget funds and other funds used for compensation.
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Administration recommends benefits for eligible employees for the 2025-2026 school year. The 2025-2026 premium sheet is attached. - Medical benefits will increase by 8.13%. District will cover the 8.13 increase for employee only coverage by increasing district contributions to plans. The district contribution will increase from $666.22 to $723.93. The High deductible plan Health Savings Account District contribution will be $565. Medical plans and structure did not change. - Current Avesis Vision plan premiums were expected to increase. We are recommending Vision Plan change to VSP which will offer a decrease in premium for the lower tier and will increase in premium for the higher tier but will provide a more robust plan. - Dental plans did not change. Dental premiums remain the same. A quality comprehensive benefit premiums & plan helps to recruit and retain the best possible employees to provide a high quality education to our students and for our community. It is recommended that all continuing certified, classified, and administrative staff receive a 2% increase. This would become effective at the start of the 2025-2026 school year. Total cost for the compensation recommendations is estimated to be approximately $1,421,000 Total impact to the budget for the benefits recommendations is approximately $554,000

agenda_items.submitted_by: Tom Huffman / Julie Jones / Mike Shepard

attachments.label: Valley Schools Employee Benefits Group_MBS_07-01-2025.pdf (1,293 KB)

motion_and_voting.motion_text:
Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the compensation increase and benefits as presented for the 2025-2026 school year.Motion by Kristen Acton, second by Eric Cultum.
Final Resolution: Motion Carries
Yes: Kristen Acton, Eric Cultum, Vickie Landis, Corby Naylor, Sarah Silk

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval of Course Proposals
agenda_items.subject: 8.17 Consideration of Approval of Course Proposals
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the proposed course name change and new course proposal for the 2025-2026 school year as presented.

narratives.PURPOSE: The purpose of the course proposals, course name changes, and course deletions process is to allow all individuals and groups/departments in the Agua Fria Union High School District 216 the opportunity to propose new courses or to revisit descriptions/names of existing courses offered for the 2025-2026 school year.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: The Governing Board should approve the proposed name change and new course proposal for the 2025-2026 school year as presented.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: It is the responsibility of the Governing Board to ensure that courses are available for all students that support Governing Board policies and goals and help to ensure that all students are career and college-ready. Governing Board Policy 5-207 – Curriculum Adoption notes that all new programs and courses of study are subject to Governing Board approval, as well as elimination of programs, extensive alteration to course content, and course name changes. The administration will make minor updates and corrections to the course description book during the year as necessary. Course proposals can be an individual or collaborative process. As new courses or courses to be revised or deleted are reviewed and approved by the Board, the Course Description Book is updated.
narratives.COMMUNITY_BENEFIT: The Academics Department is requesting a course name change for the current Agriscience II course to Biology AgriSci (Agriscience) II for the 25-26 school year. The requested change is an effort to gain NCAA approval as a course that aligns with NCAA core academic requirements. This is a name change only request. The course outline and curriculum have not changed.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: The course change has no cost impact. The new course may require the purchase of resources.
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: The Academics and ESS department is requesting a new course, ESS World Culture and Language. This course is designed for students with an Intellectual Disability (ID) Category of Eligibility to earn a Foreign Language credit. The goal is to expand opportunities for students with an Intellectual Disability through alternative scheduling, ensuring they have access to a curriculum that supports their unique learning needs. This approach allows students to engage in tailored instructional methods, providing them with the opportunity to earn a Foreign Language Credit while fostering inclusivity and academic growth.

narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Pursuant to Arizona Revised Statute 38-431.01(H), this agenda item provides an open Call to the Public allowing individuals an opportunity to address the Governing Board on any issue within the jurisdiction of the Governing Board. Members of the public wishing to address the Governing Board are required to complete a Public Participation Form and submit the completed form to the Superintendent prior to the meeting. Individuals recognized by the Board President must state his/her name. Speakers may comment on any item on the agenda or topics not listed on the agenda. No personal attacks on the Governing Board, staff or other community members will be allowed. Individual comment will be limited to no more than 3 minutes each, and no more than 30 minutes will be devoted to the Public Comment Portion of the Agenda. Governing Board members are not permitted to take action on any matter that is not on the agenda.

agenda_items.title: Instructional Time Model
agenda_items.subject: 6.2 Instructional Time Model

narratives.PURPOSE: The district will provide students the opportunity to attain their education learning online for Monday, May 12th due to the rescheduling of the district graduation ceremonies. The District’s total instructional time in the remote setting will not exceed ten percent of the District’s total instructional time. Students will learn independently with opportunities for group work or group projects. Independent learning will be supplemented by synchronous interaction with teachers.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: ARS 15-901.08 requires two public hearings prior to the adoption of an Instructional Time Model. The administration will provide an overview of the proposed Agua Fria Union High School District Instructional Time Model for Monday, May 12th.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: The Instructional Time Model under ARS 15-901.08 provides 100% of the base support level for full-time enrollment.
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: STUDENT, EMPLOYEE, AND /OR COMMUNITY BENEFIT: Students will learn independently and asynchronously. Learning will be supplemented by synchronous interaction with teachers. Teachers will maintain availability through email. Instructional activities will include videos, written material, practice work for recently learned material, project-based learning assignments, independent study, and mastery-based learning assignments in lieu of physical attendance in class.

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval of ESI Contract Renewal
agenda_items.subject: 9.11 Consideration of Approval of ESI Contract Renewal
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the Phased Retirement Agreement with ESI for fiscal year 2025-2026.

narratives.PURPOSE: For the 2025-2026 fiscal year, the District’s agreement with Educational Services, Inc. (ESI), provides continuation of employment for employees who are eligible for retirement under the Arizona State Retirement System (ASRS), but who have been offered contracts for the 2025-2026 school year. The agreement also provides the ability to obtain the services of additional personnel should vacancies occur throughout the year or to rehire retirees throughout the year as their retirement dates are actualized. There are two changes from the 2025-2026 fiscal year agreement. First change; replacing Paragraph 13, which expands the language on ESI’s Liability Insurance. Second change; replaced Exhibit A to reflect the updated fees previously shared.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: It is recommended that the Governing Board approve the agreement with Educational Services, Inc., (ESI) for the 2025-2026 fiscal year.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: Governing Board Policy 4-101
narratives.COMMUNITY_BENEFIT: An employee's participation in the phased retirement program benefits both employees and the District. The District realizes a savings while being fortunate to retain experienced and qualified employees who are eligible for retirement. Employees benefit by being retained in the position and continuing to serve the District at a reduced salary while receiving their retirement benefits. Our District has benefited for many years by being able to retain valued and experienced employees through a phased retirement program.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: Hiring retired employees through a phased retirement program, in this case ESI, creates a long-term savings for the District of approximately 7% per employee participant.

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval of Renewal of Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) with the Air Force and Agua Fria High School District
agenda_items.subject: 9.12 Consideration of Approval of Renewal of Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) with the Air Force and Agua Fria High School District
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Approve the Renewal of Access Agreement between Agua Fria Union High School District and the United States of America, acting through the Secretary of the Air Force.

narratives.PURPOSE: The purpose of this Agreement is for the Owner to grant the Government, its employees, agents, authorized representatives, and contractors, (each an “Authorized Party”) access to the Owner’s Property for the activities and purposes described herein.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approve Access Agreement between Agua Fria Union High School District and the United States of America, acting through the Secretary of the Air Force.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: The Government is conducting a groundwater investigation near Luke Air Force Base. Groundwater immediately south of Luke AFB is known to be impacted by per fluorinated compounds (“PFAS”). The groundwater south of Luke AFB in the vicinity of Camelback Road needs to be evaluated to fully understand the extent of PFAS impacts. The Government needs access to the Property to: (i) survey for, drill, and develop a monitoring well; (ii) periodically sample the well; and (iii) when such evaluation is concluded, abandon the well; and all related Government actions.

agenda_items.title: Emergency Procurement Reporting for Fiscal Year 2024-2025 Graduation Venue
agenda_items.subject: 9.13 Emergency Procurement Reporting for Fiscal Year 2024-2025 Graduation Venue
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the emergency procurement for the graduation venue fiscal year 2024-2025.

narratives.PURPOSE: Administration seeks Governing Board approval for emergency procurement for fiscal year 2024-2025 graduation venue rental and service included to Desert Diamond Arena.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: It is recommended that the Governing Board approve the emergency procurement for graduation venue rental and services included for Fiscal Year 2024-2025 to Desert Diamond Arena.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: Pursuant to A.A.C. R7-2-1056, an emergency procurement is necessary due to an urgent and unforeseen situation that requires immediate action to protect the health, safety, or continued operations of the school district. The following emergency conditions have necessitated this procurement:
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: State Farm Stadium has informed us that we will no longer be able to hold our scheduled graduation ceremony at their venue due to a larger event being booked on the same dates. This unexpected cancellation has left us without a location for this significant event, requiring immediate action to secure an alternative venue. Given the short notice of this cancellation, the standard procurement process cannot be followed without risking the inability to secure an appropriate venue in time. Graduation is a critical event for students, families, and staff, and any delay in securing a new location could result in unavailability, logistical challenges, and significant disruptions to planning. Additionally, the requirement to place a deposit quickly to hold the new venue necessitates and expedited decision making process. STUDENT, EMPLOYEE AND/OR COMMUNITY BENEFIT: Delaying procurement to follow competitive solicitation requirements would result in significant disruption to district operations and/or pose safety risks. BUDGET IMPACT AND COSTS: Detailed purchase listed below: Deposit $ 37,500 Balance$ 112,500 Total Estimated Cost of Graduation $ 150,000

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval AFHSD Gifted Scope and Sequence
agenda_items.subject: 9.14 Consideration of Approval AFHSD Gifted Scope and Sequence
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the Gifted and Talented Scope and Sequence as presented.

narratives.PURPOSE: Arizona law requires that all public school districts must both identify gifted learners and provide appropriate educational programs and services for gifted learners. The law does not prescribe the models that districts must use to serve their gifted learners. The Gifted Scope & Sequence outlines how AFHSD identifies and services gifted students.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: Administration recommends approval of the Gifted and Talented Scope and Sequence.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: Arizona Statute requires school districts to submit a Gifted Scope and Sequence to the Arizona Department of Education whenever a change is made, or every 5 years if no changes were made.Gifted and Talented Scope and Sequence is required to meet Arizona Department of Education monitoring requirements. AFHSD’s Gifted Scope and Sequence was last approved on February 17, 2021. Minor changes have been made to reflect our Academies model, current state assessments, and format.
narratives.COMMUNITY_BENEFIT: Gifted identification and service models benefit students by providing differentiated learning experiences that meet the diverse needs of students. It benefits teachers by providing them with information regarding students' learning needs, which assists in planning and instruction.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: Gifted testing and programming is funded partially from Group B weighted funds limited to educational programs for gifted pupils who score at or above the 97th percentile, based on national norms (age or grade) on a test adopted by the State Board of Education and Maintenance and Operations.

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval Personalized Admission Program and Data Sharing Agreement with Grand Canyon University (GCU)
agenda_items.subject: 9.15 Consideration of Approval Personalized Admission Program and Data Sharing Agreement with Grand Canyon University (GCU)
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the Personalized Admission Program and Data Sharing Agreement Between Agua Fria Union High School District and Grand Canyon University (GCU).

narratives.PURPOSE: The purpose of this Personalized Admission and Data Sharing Agreement is to allow the District and GCU to share Confidential Data of parents/students who provide consent, to create a personalized admission offer from GCU for District students who meet the requirements for admission.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: It is recommended that the Governing Board approve the Personalized Admission Program and Data Sharing Agreement Between Agua Fria Union High School District and Grand Canyon University (GCU).
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: District students currently benefit from personalized admissions for the three in-state universities.
narratives.COMMUNITY_BENEFIT: The Personalized Admission Program changes the traditional college application process. For parents/students who consent to have information released, GCU proactively offers student admittance. This model puts the student and family in the position of deciding to accept or decline GCU’s offer rather than GCU accepting the student. GCU will include scholarship eligibility, which may help students consider attending a postsecondary institution who otherwise may have thought it not financially feasible.

agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the award of contract for Audit Services RFP #25-02-30 to Heinfeld Meech & Co.

narratives.PURPOSE: Administration seeks Governing Board approval to award a contract for Audit Services RFP #25-02-30 to Heinfeld Meech & Co.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: It is recommended that the Governing Board award a contract for RFP #25-02-30 for Audit Services to Heinfeld Meech & Co.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: On February 13, 2025, the District issued RFP #25-02-30 for Audit Services through OpenGov and legal advertisement was published in the Arizona Business Gazette on February 13, 2025. There were two thousand nine hundred and twenty-eight (2928) notified users (vendors) and two (2) responses received. The evaluation committee consisted of Quay Bolton-Lattari (Executive Director of Support Services), Rosa Ramirez (Finance Manager), and Mike Shepard (Executive Director of Finance). The evaluation committee evaluated the proposals based on the criteria outline in the RFP.
narratives.COMMUNITY_BENEFIT: The award of a contract under this RFP will result in multi-term contract for one-year with the option of four (4) annual renewals beginning fiscal year 2025/2026. The estimated requirements cover the period of the contracts and are reasonable and continuing. The use of the subsequent multi-term contracts will serve the best interests of the school district by encouraging effective competition or otherwise promoting economies of scale in school district procurement. If monies are not appropriated or otherwise made available to support continuation of performance in a subsequent fiscal period, the contract can be canceled.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: Estimated expenditures under the contract for the first year are $54,000.00 and will be funded through M&O.

narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Pursuant to Arizona Revised Statute 38-431.01(H), this agenda item provides an open Call to the Public allowing individuals an opportunity to address the Governing Board on any issue within the jurisdiction of the Governing Board. Members of the public wishing to address the Governing Board are required to complete a Public Participation Form and submit the completed form to the Superintendent prior to the meeting. Individuals recognized by the Board President must state his/her name. Speakers may comment on any item on the agenda or topics not listed on the agenda. No personal attacks on the Governing Board, staff or other community members will be allowed. Individual comment will be limited to no more than 3 minutes each, and no more than 30 minutes will be devoted to the Public Comment Portion of the Agenda. agenda_items.subject: 9.13 Renewal E-Rate Services Agreement with Yavapai County School Superintendent
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved the Governing Board approve the Agreement for E-Rate Services between Agua Fria Union High School District and Yavapai County School Superintendent.

narratives.PURPOSE: The purpose of this agreement is that Agua Fria Union High School District retains Yavapai County School Superintendent (“YCSS”) to provide consulting about and assistance with E-Rate Services pursuant to a service program under A.R.S. § 15-365. YCSS assists school districts, individual schools and libraries with the compliance of applicable regulations to obtain all available E-Rate Services at the lowest cost. The E-Rate Services provided by YCSS are intended to support and enhance student achievement by assisting and guiding School to plan, procure, and implement essential technology assets.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: It is recommended the Governing Board approve the Agreement for E-Rate Services between Agua Fria Union High School District No. 216 and Yavapai County School Superintendent.
narratives.COMMUNITY_BENEFIT: Services will be used to maximize funding through the E-Rate program of traditional Category 1 funds, Category 2 funds, and funding though the FCC's Emergency Connectivity Fund (ECF)
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: BOARD POLICIES OR GOALS ADDRESSED AND/OR BACKGROUND This agreement aligns with the AFUHSD Strategic Plan; Priority Six: Implement Technology Integration and Innovation.

agenda_items.title: Request to Address the Governing Board
agenda_items.subject: 4.1 Request to Address the Governing Board

narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Pursuant to Arizona Revised Statute 38-431.01(H), this agenda item provides an open Call to the Public allowing individuals an opportunity to address the Governing Board on any issue within the jurisdiction of the Governing Board. Members of the public wishing to address the Governing Board are required to complete a Public Participation Form and submit the completed form to the Superintendent prior to the meeting. Individuals recognized by the Board President must state his/her name. Speakers may comment on any item on the agenda or topics not listed on the agenda. No personal attacks on the Governing Board, staff or other community members will be allowed. Individual comment will be limited to no more than 3 minutes each, and no more than 30 minutes will be devoted to the Public Comment Portion of the Agenda. Governing Board members are not permitted to take action on any matter that is not on the agenda.

The Agua Fria UHSD has been covered by the TRUST for several years for the District's liability, pre-paid legal, and workers' compensation insurance coverage. The TRUST runs several valuable programs such as cyber security services, transportation leadership "Train-the-Trainer", emergency response/security consortiums, hearing officer training, preparing district staff for student disciplinary hearings, bus simulator, weather alert program. agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval ESA Tuition Rate
agenda_items.subject: 7.20 Consideration of Approval ESA Tuition Rate
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the ESA Tuition rate for the 2025-2026 school year.

narratives.PURPOSE: Empowerment Scholarship Account (ESA) Program
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: Administration recommends the Governing Board approve the ESA Tuition rate for the 2025-2026 school year.
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Beginning in the 2022-2023 school year, H.B. 2853 expanded the Empowerment Scholarship Account (ESA) Program universally for all Arizona students in kindergarten through grade 12. An ESA is an account administered by the Arizona Department of Education and funded by state tax dollars to provide options for the education of qualified students in the state of Arizona. By accepting an ESA, a student may not enroll in a public district school, charter school, and/or public online school (including summer public school), without paying the school, or accept any School Tuition Organization (STO) scholarship or tax credit scholarship. Administration seeks Governing Board approval of the ESA Tuition rate for Fiscal Year 2025-2026 for an ESA student. ESA Tuition shall be charged at $1,270.00 per class for each semester. An additional $1,000.00 shall be charged for each club or extra curricular activity. This would create a separate tuition rate for the purposes of ESA students.

motion_and_voting.motion_text:
Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the ESA Tuition rate for the 2025-2026 school year. Revisit in December for the 2026-2027 school yearMotion by Eric Cultum, second by Sarah Silk.

agenda_items.title: Approval of Course Descriptions for The Hilltop School for the Arts for the 2026–2027 School Year
agenda_items.subject: 7.22 Approval of Course Descriptions for The Hilltop School for the Arts for the 2026–2027 School Year
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approved the Course Descriptions for the Hilltop School for the Arts for the 2025-2026 school year as presented.

narratives.PURPOSE: The course descriptions and outlines for The Hilltop School for the Arts are submitted for Governing Board review and approval. These overviews reflect the school’s specialized focus in the fine arts and highlight the distinctive educational opportunities it offers. The development of this specialized course catalog represents a key milestone as The Hilltop administration prepares to host informational sessions for prospective students and their families.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: It is recommended that the Governing Board approve the proposed new courses for The Hilltop School for the Arts for the 2025–2026 school year as presented.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: In alignment with Governing Board Policies IGA (Curriculum Development), IGD (Curriculum Adoption), and IHA (Basic Instructional Program), all new courses are subject to approval by the Governing Board. The proposed courses support the district's strategic commitment to diverse learning pathways, curriculum innovation, and responsiveness to evolving student needs and aspirations. Due to the number of new courses associated with The Hilltop School for the Arts, a new individual course proposal form is not being submitted for each course. The Hilltop staff will continue to work on curriculum development this summer and can provide updates at a future board meeting.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: The district has provided stipends for curricular work. Additional stipends will be provided in June of 2025 for continued curriculum work. Textbooks and instructional resources for each course will be identified and reviewed during the Fall of 2025. Course implementation will utilize The Hilltop instructional staff and facilities.
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: STUDENT, EMPLOYEE, AND /OR COMMUNITY BENEFIT: These new courses will expand access to high-quality instruction and learning experiences in fine and performing arts and support students to develop specialized industry skills, critical thinking, creativity, and collaboration skills. They will also provide foundational training for students pursuing postsecondary studies or careers in the arts. The community benefits through enhanced arts programming and potential public exhibitions and performances. The Hilltop does not assess individual course fees. Instead, students are required to pay an annual Arts Academy Fee of $200. This comprehensive fee supports program-wide resources, materials, and experiences that enhance student learning and artistic development. Due to the breadth of fine arts offerings at The Hilltop, this consolidated annual fee represents a more cost-effective approach for families compared to applying individual course fees equivalent to those at a comprehensive campus.

agenda_items.title: Consideration of Approval of Data Sharing Agreement with Litchfield Elementary School District
agenda_items.subject: 7.25 Consideration of Approval of Data Sharing Agreement with Litchfield Elementary School District
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved that the Governing Board approves the date sharing agreement between Litchfield Elementary School District LESD and Agua Fria High District as presented.

narratives.PURPOSE: The purpose of this agreement is to facilitate the sharing of student data between Litchfield Elementary School District (LESD) and Agua Fria Union High School District (AFUHSD) to support the successful transition of LESD students into high school. The agreement enables AFUHSD to view relevant student data to expedite enrollment and tailor instructional services, and provides LESD with aggregated data on former students to evaluate and enhance its academic programming.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: It is recommended that the Governing Board approve the Data Sharing Agreement. This collaboration underscores the district’s commitment to data-informed decision-making and strengthening student support across educational transitions.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: This Data Sharing Agreement aligns with AFUHSD’s strategic objectives of fostering collaboration with partner districts and using data to improve student outcomes. It adheres to state and federal laws, including FERPA and ARS §15-141, ensuring that all shared data is handled securely and confidentially.
narratives.COMMUNITY_BENEFIT: Students benefit from a smoother and more informed transition from elementary to high school, as AFUHSD will be able to prepare more accurately for the needs of incoming students. LESD benefits by receiving detailed reports on student progress and performance in high school, which informs their instructional strategies and program effectiveness.
narratives.BUDGET_IMPACT: There is no additional cost to the Agua Fria Union High School District associated with this agreement.

agenda_items.title: Renewal of Intergovernmental Agreement with of Goodyear for School Resource Officers for the 2025-2026 School Year.
agenda_items.subject: 7.29 Renewal of Intergovernmental Agreement with of Goodyear for School Resource Officers for the 2025-2026 School Year.
agenda_items.recommendedAction: Be it resolved the Governing Board approves the Intergovernmental Agreement with City of Goodyear for School Resource Officers for the 2025-2026 school year.

narratives.PURPOSE: The Purpose of the agenda item is to request the approval for Agua Fria Union High School District to enter into an Intergovernmental Agreement (IGA) with the City of Goodyear for the provision of School Resource Officer for the 2025-2026 school year.
narratives.RECOMMENDATION: Administration recommends that the Governing Board approve entering into the IGA with the City Goodyear for the provision of SRO for the 2025-2026 School year.
narratives.BOARD_POLICIES: The City of Goodyear will provide a sworn, certified officer to serve as School Resource Officer at Desert Edge High School, Millennium High School and Goodyear High School
narratives.ADDITIONAL_NOTES: STUDENT, EMPLOYEE AND/OR COMMUNITY BENEFIT: BUDGET IMPACT AND COSTS: The District shall pay 50% of the cost associated with SRO Services received on an hourly per diem (hourly pay rate plus actual cost of employer-paid benefits) basis for ten-month period covering the school year; the City shall pay 100% of the SRO’s cost during the summer break and any other school breaks or school observed holidays or vacations during which the City assigns the SRO to City-related duties.
